result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Sidney Earl Rushing not in court, in custody.  Attorney Frederick F Klimetz mr. appeared by video for Sidney Earl Rushing.  Attorney Katie Bakunowicz appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Scheduling conference held. Defense counsel requests an additional scheduling conference. Case is adjourned to Br. 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 08:30 am.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR. 10:
Defendant Sidney Earl Rushing appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Frederick F Klimetz mr. in court for Sidney Earl Rushing.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer W. Mauch. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 29.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sidney Earl Rushing not in court, in custody.  Attorney Frederick F Klimetz in court for Sidney Earl Rushing.  Prosecuting Attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness was not served. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 29, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Sidney Earl Rushing not in court, in custody.  Attorney Frederick F Klimetz mr. appeared by video for Sidney Earl Rushing.  Attorney Ryan Jay Michaels appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status of Counsel. Defense counsel advises that he was recently appointed, and requests a preliminary hearing date. Case adjourned to Prelim Court.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Order Appointing Counsel
Received and Filed. Order Appointing Counsel

Defendant Sidney Earl Rushing not in court, defendant in custody.  Tristan J. Bednarek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. Defendant not produced. The PD's Office needs additional time to appoint counsel. Court orders matter adjourned for a status of counsel hearing in Branch 29.  Status conference scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Thomas R. Reed in court, defendant Sidney Earl Rushing not in court, in custody.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a State v Lee hearing.  Matter held via Zoom video conference and streamed through DAcast. Attorney Reed provides an update to the Court. The PD's Office needs additional time to appoint counsel. Court finds CAUSE to adjourn the preliminary hearing. Court orders matter adjourned for a status of counsel hearing in Branch 29.  Status conference scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 08:30 am.
SPD Appointment of Counsel Report, filed.

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR 29
Defendant Sidney Earl Rushing not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is GRANTED. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a STATE V-LEE Hearing in the trial court.  Hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Received and filed a Motion and Notice of Motion for Bail Reduction from defendant.  DK

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR 29
Defendant Sidney Earl Rushing not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing. Request is denied. Motion and Notice of Motion for Bail Reduction ( Sidney Rushing- 2022005712 House of Correction 8885 S 68th Street. Franklin, WI 53132)

Defendant Sidney Earl Rushing not in court, defendant in custody.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. Court adjourns case for an attorney to be appointed. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Sheila A. W.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Sidney Earl Rushing in court with attorney Angel L Johnson.  Defendant Sidney Earl Rushing in custody.  Patrick J Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sidney Earl Rushing appeared by video means with Attorney. Defense argues to strike Domestic abuse assessments enhancers (973.055(1)) to counts 1-3. State argues, Court DENY motion.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
